claims.summary: Case reports describe malignant hyperthermia-like reactions in patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy who received succinylcholine during anesthesia, indicating an elevated perioperative risk associated with succinylcholine in this population.

supporting_evidence.article_title: Safety considerations for neuromuscular blockade in dystrophinopathies
key_points: Case reports highlight malignant hyperthermia-like reactions when patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy receive succinylcholine during anesthesia.
These reports suggest an elevated perioperative risk associated with succinylcholine in dystrophinopathies.
